4.5 millones de venezolanos se han visto obligados a abandonar sus hogares, muchos caminando largas distancias en condiciones muy peligrosas. Esta es una tragedia humanitaria. Debemos redoblar nuestros esfuerzos para avanzar un retorno pacífico a la democracia en Venezuela.
No podemos olvidar la crisis en Venezuela. Mientras los venezolanos luchan por sus vidas, el régimen de Maduro sigue robando los recursos del país.

Hoy me reuní con @JulioBorges y @carlosvecchio del gobierno legítimo de @jguaido, y @RafaelDGuzmanR y @JuanAndresMejia de la Asamblea Nacional elegida democráticamente por el pueblo venezolano. pic.twitter.com/sVACOvPNOn

4.5 million Venezuelans have been forced to leave their homes, many walking hundreds of miles through very dangerous conditions. This is a humanitarian tragedy. We must redouble our efforts to advance a peaceful, civilian-led return to democracy in Venezuela.
We cannot lose sight of the crisis in Venezuela. While Venezuelans are struggling to survive, the Maduro regime continues to plunder the country’s resources with reckless abandon.

Today, I met with @JulioBorges and @carlosvecchio of the legitimate interim government of @jguaido, and @RafaelDGuzmanR and @JuanAndresMejia of Venezuela’s democratically elected National Assembly. pic.twitter.com/kKNhhmzxKj

Voy a hacer todo lo posible por trabajar con nuestros aliados y seguir apoyando el esfuerzo global para combatir el cambio climático.
Estoy muy decepcionado de escuchar que las conferencias @APEC y #COP25, programadas para realizarse en Chile, se hayan cancelado abruptamente. La #CrisisClimatica es el mayor desafío que enfrentamos.
I will do all I can to work with our allies and continue supporting the global effort to combat climate change.
Very disappointed to hear the upcoming @APEC and #COP25 conferences, scheduled to take place in Chile, have been abruptly canceled. The #Climatecrisis is the greatest challenge we face.

Appreciative to see the Brussels Solidarity Conference yielded $133 million in additional commitments to support Venezuelan migrants. Thank you @FedericaMog and @Refugees for your leadership. #Together4Venezuelans: https://bit.ly/2qXeXu5

Como presidente del subcomité del hemisferio occidental, voy a seguir monitoreando esta situación y apoyando al pueblo chileno y al gobierno chileno en sus esfuerzos para fortalecer su democracia aún más y construir una economía que da resultados para todos los chilenos.
Insisto en la cesación de cualquier acto de violencia y espero que pueda haber un diálogo productivo entre los líderes de las manifestaciones pacíficas y el gobierno chileno.

El Embajador Silva se comprometió conmigo que el gobierno chileno está investigando estos hechos. El gobierno chileno ha invitado también a la @OACNUDH y la @CIDH para investigar la situación de derechos humanos en Chile.

Hoy me reuní con el embajador Alfonso Silva de @EmbajadaChileUS. Le expresé mi preocupación con respecto a las manifestaciones en Chile y particularmente los reportes mediáticos que indican el posible uso excesivo de la fuerza contra manifestantes pacíficos. pic.twitter.com/Pldva1b0r2

In my capacity as Chairman of the Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere, I will continue to monitor this situation closely and to support the Chilean people and the Chilean government in their ongoing efforts to create an even more vibrant democracy and economy.
I urge restraint from any acts of violence and sincerely hope there can be a productive dialogue between peaceful demonstration leaders and the government.

Ambassador Silva committed to me that the Chilean government is actively investigating these incidents. The Chilean government has also invited @UNHumanRights and @IACHR to visit Chile to look into human rights concerns.

Today, I met with Ambassador Alfonso Silva of @EmbajadaChileUS. I expressed my concern about the demonstrations in Chile and particularly media reports of possible use of excessive force against peaceful protesters. pic.twitter.com/QeGcRwrro7

Today, I supported H.R.1497 to provide $16.7b for water infra projects and $14b to finance state clean water projects. This is money that Newark can use to upgrade its water infra. Also, every $1b invested in water infra yields 27k jobs. I am proud to support this bill.

Today is #NationalTakeBackDay. Visit a DEA collection site near you to responsibly dispose of your unused prescription drugs. This year, vaping devices will also be collected. To find a collection site near you visit:  https://takebackday.dea.gov/

Additionally, we must protect the future generations of LBTQ+ Americans. I cosponsored H.R. 2775, the Protecting LGBTQ+ Youth Act to increase resources and update practices that allow child welfare professionals to save LGBTQ+ youth from abusive households.

I also cosponsored H.R. 3509, the LGBT Data inclusion Act, to make sure LGBTQ+ individuals are accurately recognized by our federal government.  This bill would add sexual identity and gender representation to all standard demographic information collection by federal agencies.
This bill would fortify the rights the LGBTQ+ community has fought for, specifically adding sex, sexual orientation, and gender identity protections to the 1964 Civil Rights Act.
This year I was a proud to be an original cosponsor of the most comprehensive federal package of LGBTQ+ legislation to date, H.R. 5, the Equality Act.

October is #LGBTHistoryMonth, a time to celebrate and learn about the many achievements of the #LGBT community in U.S. history. The best way to honor the LBGTQ+ activists and advocates in our history is to protect the future of equal rights for all Americans.

The President should call on @senatemajldr to stop blocking legislation that would improve the lives of millions instead of having them sit in legislative purgatory. Every day of inaction by the Senate leads to one more avoidable gun death, missed payment, or missed prescription.

The international community should be denouncing Maduro’s egregious violations of human rights, not elevating his murderous regime.
